intro: Synotis lushaiensis, commonly known as the Lushai Hills synotis, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Synotis lushaiensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
